name: Criminal property damage in the third degree
text:
(1)  A person commits the offense of criminal property damage in the third degree if:



	(a)	The person recklessly damages the property of another, without the other's consent, by the use of widely dangerous means; or
	(b)	The person intentionally damages the property of another, without the other's consent, in an amount exceeding $500.



	(2)  Criminal property damage in the third degree is a misdemeanor. [L 1972, c 9, pt of §1; am L 1973, c 136, §7(c); am L 1986, c 314, §62; gen ch 1993; am L 1996, c 170, §3]
